comment.author: 7471115@N08
comment._content: Title should read "Launch of Viribus Unitas at Trieste." Am very much enjoying your photos!

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: June 24, 1911, according to www.viribusunitis.ca/index.htm At www.viribusunitis.ca/movie-VU.htm there is a movie of the launching. On the web one can find "Unitis" and "Unitas" but the name on her hull seems to be Unitis (clearer on the high res image at LoC) and the voiceover on the movie sounds that way too. See also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMS_Viribus_Unitis

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: Viribus Unitis, in Latin meaning "With United Forces", was an Austro-Hungarian Dreadnought built between 1910-1912, and was regarded by many as being a very beautiful warship. The Viribus Unitis had an uneventful career spending most of her time in the port of Pula during the war, and never fired a shot in anger against an enemy ship. The most interesting day in her short life was the day she exploded and sank. Italian frogmen snuck up on her in the middle of the night and planted explosives underneath her. She blew up on the morning of 1 Nov 1918; rolled over and sank upside down in the mud of Pula Harbour. She was later partially scrapped from keel to the main deck, but remains are still in Pula harbour.

comment.author: 48232334@N03
comment._content: I have flown into Trieste airport - my brother lived in nearby Grado, a small seaside resort, for 10 years - un luogo bellissimo e tranquillo!

comment.author: 54637808@N04

comment._content: The link in the comment above did not work for me. Perhaps this will www.misterkappa.it/cvf-rph01.html The metadata for the postcard of the launch shown on the page does in fact confirm the June 11 date. The postcard was written on November 4, 1911.
